newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: SOCCER-PORTO CAPTAIN COSTA HAS KNEE SURGERY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-PORTO CAPTAIN COSTA HAS KNEE SURGERY.

text.p: Porto captain and defender Jorge Costa underwent surgery on Friday to a ruptured ligament in his left knee and could be out of action for six months, team doctor Mario Beca said on Saturday.
Costa was injured in a tackle with Polish team mate Grzegorz Mielcarski during pre-season training with his club in Sweden earlier this week.
He returned home immediately and was operated on for two hours in a hospital in Oporto.
Costa underwent surgery to the same knee for a similar injury in April 1996, forcing him out of the national team for the European championship finals in England two months later.
Porto have won the Portuguese first division title for the past three years.
